definition[0]: to get rid of something, especially something that is difficult to get rid of
example[0]: an incinerator built to dispose of toxic waste
definition[1]: to sell something, especially part of a business
example[1]: I am still not sure how best to dispose of the shares.
definition[2]: to deal with something such as a problem or question successfully
example[2]: Your idea at least disposes of the immediate problem.
example[3]: Two goals by Ra√∫l disposed of Barcelona.
definition[4]: to get rid of something that is no longer needed or wanted
example[4]: We charge customers as little as DM50 to dispose of an old computer terminal.
example[5]: Most of those properties will be disposed of over the next five years.
